text: John William Alan Okell OBE (; 1934 - 3 August 2020) was a British linguist. He was known for his studies related to Burma. Okell was born in Brighton, England.About SOAS: John Okell OBE. Archived copy."SOAS scholar awarded OBE for services to UK-Burma relations" (3 July 2014). Archived copy. He retired from the School of Oriental and African Studies in 1999, although he remained a research associate in the Department of South East Asia.Department Staff: Mr John Okell. Archived copy. In 2014, in the Queen's Birthday Honours, he was made an Officer of the Order of the British Empire for services to UK/Burma relations. He died on 3 August 2020 at the age of 86."From the Archive: Love of the Lingo" (The Irrawaddy, 5 August 2020).
